actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-267, by Mr. Derrick.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1495 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions. General debate time will be divided equally between the Committee on Foreign Affairs and the Committee on Armed Services. All points of order for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 5(a) of Rule XXI are waived. Measure will be read by title. Bill is open to amendments. The amendments recommended by the Committee on Armed Services may be considered en bloc as amendments to Title II.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 62.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 1495) to amend the Arms Control and Disarmament Act to authorize appropriations for the Arms Control and Disarmament Agency, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 1495 (arms control activities).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 1495) to amend the Arms Control and Disarmament Act to authorize appropriations for the Arms Control and Disarmament Agency, and for other purposes.
